block.p: Shilpa Patel, the daughter of Dr. Shaila Patel and Dr. Sumant Patel of Houston, was married there yesterday to Christopher Lynn Larson, a son of Linda Larson and Robert Larson of Fort Collins, Colo. The Rev. Dr. Helen Appelberg, an Episcopal priest, officiated at a ceremony that incorporated Christian and Hindu traditions at the Hotel Derek.

Mrs. Larson, 27, received a law degree in June from Brooklyn Law School and now volunteers at the Cancer Advocacy Project at the City Bar Association, for which she compiled a Medicaid guide. She graduated from Tufts.
The couple were married on Saturday at the Hotel Derek in Houston in a ceremony that incorporated Christian and Hindu traditions.

Shilpa Patel, the daughter of Dr. Shaila Patel and Dr. Sumant Patel of Houston, was married there yesterday to Christopher Lynn Larson, a son of Linda Larson and Robert Larson of Fort Collins, Colo. The Rev. Dr. Helen Appelberg, an Episcopal priest, officiated at a ceremony that incorporated Christian and Hindu traditions at the Hotel Derek.

Mrs. Larson, 27, received a law degree in June from Brooklyn Law School and now volunteers at the Cancer Advocacy Project at the City Bar Association, for which she compiled a Medicaid guide. She graduated from Tufts.

The bride's father is a radiologist at Conroe-Tomball Radiologists in Tomball, Tex., and the Woodlands, Tex. Her mother is a pediatrician at Texas Children's Pediatric Associates, a group medical practice in Houston. She is also the president of Daya, a nonprofit organization there that assists South Asian victims of domestic violence.
Mr. Larson, 28, is the political director for the 21st Century Freedom PAC, a political action committee established by Gov. George E. Pataki. He graduated from Yale.
The bridegroom's father is an optometrist in Fort Collins.
